ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Re: BroadScope Crawl and out of memory error
ygData.msgSnippet: ... Do. I ve set up a crawl using your order file.  I changed the user agent and from fields to point to us.  Using a smaller heap, 512megs, I m having better

Saurabh Pathak wrote:

> ...
> >
> > You might try w/ SUN's JVM -- the 1.5.x JVM -- rather than blackdown to
> > see if that gets you further.
>
> I will try that.

Do.

I've set up a crawl using your order file.  I changed the user agent and 
from fields to point to us.  Using a smaller heap, 512megs, I'm having 
better luck than you:

*Crawler running:*  	Yes
*Current job:*  	Auto launched
*Jobs pending:*  	0
*Jobs completed:*  	0

	
*Used memory:*  	362029 KB
*Heap size:*  	518336 KB
*Max heap size:*  	518336 KB
* Alerts: * 	0 (0 new) <http://dev04.archive.org:8080/console/alerts.jsp>


*Status:*  	Running
*Processed docs/sec:*  	47.3 (59.96)     *KB/sec:* 3339 (2310)
*Run time:*  	2 h., 26 min. and 18 sec.

	

*Active thread count:*  	49 of 50
*Total data received:*  	19 GB


*_DOWNLOADED/QUEUED DOCUMENT RATIO_*

	*15*% 	
	  (526369 of 3357661)



I'll let it run overnight to see how far it gets.

Here's my vitals for comparison:

> > Otherwise, please send your order and seeds  -- if thats possible.

>
> I just send the order file and seeds.txt to your yahoo account. If you
> do get a chance please try to run the crawl at your machine.
>
> I appreciate your time and help.
>
> Regards,
>
> Saurabh

> --- In archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com, stack <stack@a...> wrote:
> > Saurabh Pathak wrote:
> >
> > >
> > > Thanks Michael and Gordon for your inputs,
> > > ...
> > >
> > > I looked at my module and dont think that it is creating OOM. To be
> > > sure I ran the crawler without my custom module and I ran out of
> > > memory again. I tried running a broadscope crawl on a debian machine
> > > using the 1.3 snapshot of the CVS head from last week. I also used
> > > BdBFrontier with 50 threads and allocated 1024M heap. This time
> > > crawler ran out of memory after downloaing some 90000 documents.
> >
> > Are you overriding the default heritrix.properties file?  In
> particular,
> > this line: 'org.archive.crawler.datamodel.BigMapFactory.class =
> > org.archive.crawler.datamodel.CachedBdbBigMap'?
> >
> > You might try w/ SUN's JVM -- the 1.5.x JVM -- rather than blackdown to
> > see if that gets you further.
> >
> > Otherwise, please send your order and seeds  -- if thats possible.
> I'll
> > try running with it over on this end.
> >
> > Thanks Saurabh.

> > > > Yours,
> > > > St.Ack
> > > >
> > > >
> > > > Gordon Mohr (@Internet Archive) wrote:
> > > >
> > > > > Once an OutOfMemoryError is hit, a crawl attempts to pause,
> but will
> > > > > often be
> > > > > unable to proceed in any meaningful way, depending on what
> > > operation was
> > > > > prevented by the OOM.
> > > > >
> > > > > Is the web UI responsive, and can you get a thread report?
> > > > >
> > > > > I notice a custom Processor, and HTML parser, in ToeThread #34. It
> > > would
> > > > > be interesting to see what URL that thread is working on, and
> for how
> > > > > long.
> > > > > It, or other custom code that's growing a data structure as
> the crawl
> > > > > proceeds, could be the cause of the OOM. Our stock crawler
> components
> > > > > might
> > > > > hit an OOM for any broad crawl eventually, but typically not so
> > > soon with
> > > > > such a large heap.
> > > > >
> > > > > - Gordon @ IA
> > > > >
> > >
